title: Orders for a new all-electric plane now top 150
text:
London | Electric-plane start-up Eviation Aircraft says it has signed up two more customers for its pioneering commuter aircraft, taking the order backlog to more than 150 planes.

Both buyers are American and are recognised names in the aviation industry, chief executive officer Omer Bar-Yohay said on Thursday in an interview, declining to name them before formal announcements early next year.

CEO Omer Bar-Yohay inside Eviation Aircraft's Alice plane. Bloomberg

Eviation's plane, the Alice, is in the vanguard of a push into all-electric models. The company is betting its nine-passenger capacity and 650-mile (1046km) range will attract environmentally conscious buyers in a commuter market served by a variety of light aircraft.

Running costs will be about $US200 ($2935) per flight hour versus $US1000 for a turboprop, though the model will be slower than some conventional craft.

Eviation now expects its first flight next year rather than before Christmas as initially targeted, as US Federal Aviation Administration certification has slipped towards 2022, according to Bar-Yohay, who spoke in Tel Aviv, near where the company is based.
description: Eviation Aircraft is betting the Alice's nine-passenger capacity and 1046km range will attract environmentally conscious buyers in a commuter market.
